revision.comment: rename 'words' -> 'terms' in manually-specified affix categories (see [[Wiktionary:Beer parlour/2022/August]])
revision.text: ==English== {{wp}} ===Etymology=== From the {{der|en|ang|-}} personal name {{m|ang|Eofor}}, a byname from {{m|ang|eofor||wild boar}}, + {{m|en|-s-}} + {{m|ang|lÄ“ah||woodland clearing, glade}} {{cln|en|terms suffixed with -leigh}}. ===Proper noun=== {{en-proper noun|~|Yearsleys}} # {{place|en|village/and/cpar|in|dist/Hambleton|co/North Yorkshire|cc/England}} {{q|[[OS]] grid ref SE5874}}. # {{surname|en|[[habitational]]|from=Old English}}. ====Statistics==== * According to the 2010 United States Census, ''Yearsley'' is the 32302<sup>nd</sup> most common surname in the United States, belonging to 713 individuals. ''Yearsley'' is most common among White (94.95%) individuals. ===Further reading=== * {{R:en:DAFN}}
